messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Sandra is always right,and Bridgit is always mad about it...
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I ve only been a member for about 2 weeks now, and didn t think that I d said anything that could be construed as attacking Sandra (don t know her, why
messages.messageBody:
Well, I've only been a member for about 2 weeks now, and didn't think that I'd said anything that could be construed as attacking Sandra (don't know her, why would I?) but so far I've had my competence as a parent questioned, and been told that my son's stressfull environment has caused all his health problems, and basically, that if I had simply parented my child in the exact same way she had parented hers, then he would be happy, healthy and wise (and by extension, that he isn't right now.)

I've been wondering just what the heck is going on. I joined this group, looking forward to people who accepted and embraced unschooling, only to find out that I don't unschool "enough". I don't know what the real point of this group is, but it sure wasn't what was described in the Yahoo group page, and I don't know if I belong here at all.

Allison
----- Original Message -----
From: ddzimlew@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, November 16, 2001 10:22 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Sandra is always right,and Bridgit is always mad about it...



> why Sandra can say just about
> anything she wants here,.... and not one of you calls her on
> it.

LMAO! Someone is always on Sandra about something! Always. I had to
keep a box of tissue by me at all times when I first joined this list.

Very funny! Maybe she should run for God, or something. But, we'd have
to pass a test to vote. Question # 1. Who's always right?

Who would be the AntiSandra? ( on any given day)

Deb L
